name: St. Pamphilus of Caesarea

locations.description: Priest and biblical scholar in Caesarea

summary: Pamphilus was a priest and biblical scholar who established a library and scriptorium in Caesarea. He was a student of Pierius and worked on producing accurate copies of the Scriptures. He was martyred during the Diocletianic persecution. His student Eusebius of Caesarea wrote a biography of him.
